As a result, the number of freight vessels scheduled to arrive at the Port of Los Angeles is on track to be down 33% year-over-year for the week ending May 10,Â [according to ship tracking data](https://volumes.portoptimizer.com/)Â from Port Optimizer.  >Typically, U.S. retailers would be ramping up their orders for two critical periods later this year: the fall back-to-school shopping season and the winter holidays.
